messages: e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:28): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, Hixie: are you going to float this idea to public-webapps?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:31): I hope Hixie will; I don't quite have the full picture

e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:31): Hixie: it seems there's a fairly broad agreement about templates being non-reflective. Should I document this in a bug somewhere or what do I do? Teach me the proces, Master
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:31): I just thought it should be considered in the XBL discussion as it seemed like a nice enough idea
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:34): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024, it being documented in email should be sufficient assuming Hixie will continue to be the editor of that document
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:34): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: great!
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:37): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: how about "HTML Components"?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:37): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024, btw, http://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-HTMLComponents
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:37): aah, cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 won
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:37): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: sure, sounds good :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:38): wow, i didn't know they made a w3c spec for it
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:38): it's not a spec, it's a note. Which means we can take the name, right?
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:38): knows nothing about standards process.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:38): except that it's painful
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:39): names are not really reserved, but picking a name that does not conflict with what Microsoft did might be wise
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:39): "The spec formerly know as XBL2"
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:40): know->known drats
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:40): DOM Chunks
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:41): ooh, new Opera build is significantly better
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:41): at least in terms of tab space allocation
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:42): DOM Chunks haha
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:42): same as in previous build. keep up! or, i mean, you're on vacation, go away :P
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:42): though it would have to be Web Chunks ;p
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (22:42): Web Slices? oh wait
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:44): I don't see a problem with using Web Components
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:45): It's not like Oracle is going to come at us for naming the spec Web SQL Database :)
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:45): and it makes good sense

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (22:49): If it is going to be part of HTML it will just be part of HTML... No separate name needed. If it is going to be part of CSS I suspect something like CSS Components Module...
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (22:54): Well, it's still useful to have a name for the chunk, like Web Storage or Server-Sent Events have.
171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39 (22:54): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: "maximum-pleasure encapsulation" makes me feel dirty inside.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (22:59): 171db427cee236fc04af9e5de94e7c39: mission accomplished!
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:12): fwiw, i recall that when i was a beginner with html and css, i wanted a way to put html in css
eab22ddafe9ed99f3735e412bf7ae3e3 (23:13): Hixie, ping?
042dd99eb0ff8653814e445ca0093427 (23:18): not currently online it seems

faaeafa3e4dd09e52d2f5f413cb28f9e (23:21): "Bad value tablist for attribute role on element ul." How is this possible? According to the HTML5 spec, "tablist" is a valid role attribute value for the ul element.
faaeafa3e4dd09e52d2f5f413cb28f9e (23:26): http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/#annotations-for-assistive-technology-products-%28aria%29
faaeafa3e4dd09e52d2f5f413cb28f9e (23:31): Anyone?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:35): faaeafa3e4dd09e52d2f5f413cb28f9e: http://bugzilla.validator.nu/

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:37): send email to <email/> if you don't want to register
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:39): is impressed that e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 managed to turn the XBL2 discussion into a naming bikeshed so early and so eagerly
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:40): haha http://www.flickr.com/photos/tantek/5218572290/ CSS WG in action
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:40): I vote for WebCOM, of course. Because what could be make web developers feel more like Real Programmers (TM) than using COM
